ygData.subject: Re: Hello All
ygData.msgSnippet: I have been in a couple of guild adventures.  It s not too hard to get 6 guildies together, but not all the time. And the main idea of all these adventures is
ygData.messageBody:
I have been in a couple of guild adventures. It's not too hard to
get 6 guildies together, but not all the time.

And the main idea of all these adventures is to get to the named mob,
because that is where the big drop is. Rangers and Druids have
track, so once again we have a use. And that snare helps too when
they go for friends!

Tuldayen Grimblade
Pathfinder of Tunare
Summoners of the Realm, Terris-Thule

--- In EverQuest@yahoogroups.com, "Dave Lyles" <dwlyles@h...> wrote:
> I'm a level 41 Half Elf Druid. Like you, I have soloed most of my
life. What I have found about LDoN is, true you have to group. But
the organization is there, so that the groups constantly change.
Most often I am asked to join by putting my LFG flag up. The
adventures are short, 2 hrs and have a specific goal to obtain. The
exp is great, typically half a level per adventure. We druids are
popular for our regen buff and healing, and have counteract poison up
if someone's gonna play with the crates. You can save yourself in
time if your fast. Then, after 2 hrs, you split the loot, typically
50 - 80 plat your share, and go back to soloing. I thought it was
more for guilds as well, but have yet to see a group of all one
guild. I am typically quiet (I type slow, hehe) but so much goes on
so fast, that nobody seems to mind.
>
> Tokool Espirit
> Lany's server
> ----- Original Message -----
> From: mlockridge01
> To: EverQuest@yahoogroups.com

>
>
> I am a lvl 41 Halfling Druid. Haven't purchased LDoN yet, as I
most
> often play solo and don't know that I would use it. Have
everything up
> to this expansion, but am not convinced that it is worthwhile.
Sounds
> very nice, but I have had two guilds I have been a part of fade
away,
> and this sounds like something best suited to guilds.
>
> Barto Proudfoot
> Zeb server
>
